alert.note: Alert for Jackson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 11 at 9:24PM CDT until May 12 at 11:48PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... Lavaca River near Edna affecting Jackson County. For the Lavaca River...including Edna...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Lavaca River near Edna. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, Flooding along the Lavaca River reaches well into the lower floodplain backing up sloughs and low areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 22.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:15 PM CDT Thursday was 22.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 22.4 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 22.4 feet on 05/20/1980. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Lavaca River Edna 21.0 22.3 Thu 8 pm CDT 18.2 9.9 7.7 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Friday morning at 930 AM CDT.
